importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news article's publication indicates the most up-to-date information on the incident involving Doug Martin’s death, which is critical for public awareness and tracking of developments in the investigation and community response.
This date marks when the Oakland Police Department and city officials officially released statements regarding Martin’s death, signaling the timeline of official acknowledgment and public mourning.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The incident occurred early Saturday (prior to the article's publication), and the timeline of events from arrest to death and subsequent public statements is anchored to this time frame, emphasizing urgency and immediate response.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former NFL running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died after being taken into custody during a break-in investigation in Oakland, California.
Martin, originally from Oakland and a former All-Pro, had a long-standing mental health struggle that significantly affected his life and contributed to his actions leading to his arrest.
The incident involved a brief struggle with police, during which Martin became unresponsive and later died in a hospital, with no cause of death publicly released.
The Oakland Police Department, Mayor Barbara Lee, and the Alameda County Coroner’s Office are all involved in the investigation and post-incident review.
Martin was 36 years old and had a career spanning six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders, including Pro Bowl and All-Pro honors.
The former agent Brian Murphy revealed that Martin sought medical help for mental health issues and had fled his home to enter a neighbor's home, where he was apprehended.
The death has sparked broader discussions about mental health support, police procedures during arrests, and the need for community-based mental health services in neighborhoods where athletes live.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro NFL running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at age 36 after being taken into custody by Oakland police during an investigation into a break-in. A brief struggle occurred during the arrest, and he became unresponsive, later dying in a hospital. The incident has led to public concern over mental health, police procedures, and community support. Former agent Brian Murphy revealed that Martin had long struggled with mental health issues, which likely contributed to his actions. The Oakland Police Department, Mayor Barbara Lee, and Alameda County Coroner’s Office are all involved in the investigation. Martin, originally from Oakland and raised in Stockton, had a successful NFL career with the Buccaneers and Raiders, including Pro Bowl and All-Pro honors. A cause of death has not been released, and an autopsy is pending.
title: Former NFL Star Doug Martin Dies After Arrest in Oakland Break-In Investigation
